etymologies: late 18th century: from Malay peng-guling, literally ‘roller’ (from its habit of rolling into a ball)

definitions: an African and Asian mammal that has a body covered with horny overlapping scales, a small head with elongated snout, a long sticky tongue for catching ants and termites, and a thick, tapering tail.

notes.text: Family Manidae and order Pholidota: genera Manis (three species in Asia) and Phataginus (four species in Africa)

shortDefinitions: African and Asian mammal that has body covered with horny overlapping scales, small head with elongated snout, long sticky tongue for catching ants and termites
